dcm.sync module#

Synchronize DICOM data between local and/or remote locations

Exceptions:

RepoRequiredError

Operation requires a DataRepo but a DataBucket was provided

StaticTransferError

Classes:

DynamicTransfer

A transfer where destinations are resolve dynamically

StaticOobTransferReport

Transfer report for out-of-band transfers

StaticProxyTransferReport

Static proxy transfer report

StaticStoreReport

Transfer report that only captures storage

StaticTransfer

A transfer where all destinations are statically predetermined

StaticTransferReport

Capture all possible info about a single StaticTranfer

SyncManager

Can generate and execute transfers needed to sync src and dests

SyncQueriesReport

Report for queries being performed during sync

SyncReport

Top level report from a sync operation

Transfer

Generic base class for all transfers

class dcm.sync.SyncManager[source]#

Bases: object

Can generate and execute transfers needed to sync src and dests

Data will only be retrieved locally from src at most once and then forwarded to all destinations that need it.

Data that already exists on the destinations will be skipped, unless force_all is set to True.

Parameters:

  • src – The source of data we are transferring

  • dests – One or more destinations for the data

  • trust_level –

    Assume data matches if sub-component counts match at this level

    Setting this to a level higher than IMAGE can speed up things significantly at the cost of accuracy. Has no effect if force_all is set to True.

  • force_all – Don’t skip data that already exists on the destinations

  • keep_errors – Whether or not we try to sync erroneous data

  • report – Allows live introspection of the sync process, detailed results

Methods:

__init__(src, dests[, trust_level, ...])

close()

exec_transfer(transfer)

Execute the given transfer

gen_transfers([query_res])

Generate the needed transfers

sync([query_res])

Generate and exec all transfers for query_res

dcm.sync.make_basic_validator(diff_filters=None)[source]#

Create validator that logs a warning on any differing elements

List of filter functions can be supplied to modify/delete the diffs

Parameters:

diff_filters (Optional[Iterable[Callable[[DataDiff], Optional[DataDiff]]]]) –

Return type:

Callable[[Dataset, Dataset], None]

async dcm.sync.sync_data(sources, dests, query=None, query_res=None, query_reports=None, sm_kwargs=None, dry_run=False)[source]#

Sync data from one or more sources to one or more destinations

The query paramater can be a single item that applies to all sources or a list of items (one for each source).

The data from each source if forwarded to all destinations (unless those dests filter it).

Parameters:

  • sources (List[DataBucket[Any, Any]]) – The sources we are syncing data from

  • dests (List[Union[DataBucket, Route]]) – The destinations we are syncing data to

  • query (Optional[Union[Dataset, List[Dataset]]]) – A query (or list w/ one per source) to limit the data being sent

  • query_res (Optional[List[Optional[QueryResult]]]) – A list of query results (one per source) to limit the data being sent

  • sm_kwargs (Optional[List[Dict[str, Any]]]) – The keyword arguments used to create each SyncManager

  • dry_run (bool) – Set to true to just print the transfers that would get executed

  • query_reports (Optional[List[Optional[MultiListReport[DicomOpReport]]]]) –

Return type:

List[SyncReport]
